meanings.definition: Busy or engaged in a particular activity
meanings.sent1: The children were occupied with their homework.
meanings.sent2: The office was occupied with employees working diligently.
meanings.sent3: The cat occupied itself with chasing a toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was occupied with thoughts of the upcoming exam.
meanings.sent5: The bees occupied the hive, buzzing with activity.

meanings.sent1: All the seats were occupied in the crowded theater.
meanings.sent2: The parking lot was fully occupied with cars.
meanings.sent3: The kitchen was occupied by the delicious aroma of baking bread.
meanings.sent4: His attention was fully occupied by the thrilling movie.
meanings.sent5: The hotel rooms were occupied by tourists enjoying their vacation.

meanings.definition: Seized and controlled by military force
meanings.sent1: The enemy troops occupied the city after a fierce battle.
meanings.sent2: The fortress was occupied by the invading army.
meanings.sent3: The toy soldiers playfully occupied the miniature town.
meanings.sent4: The rebels occupied the government building in protest.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins were occupied by a new civilization.
